abstract: A Swiss banking company’s $5.5 billion loan resolves a mystery over how the Charoen Pokphand Group bought the stake without financing from the state-run China Development Bank.
snippet: A Swiss banking company’s $5.5 billion loan resolves a mystery over how the Charoen Pokphand Group bought the stake without financing from the state-run China Development Bank.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — The Swiss banking giant UBS made a $5.5 billion loan early this year to help a Thai company acquire a 15.6 percent stake in China’s Ping An Insurance Group, according to people briefed on the deal.

headline.main: UBS Aided Purchase of Stake in Chinese Insurer
headline.print_headline: UBS Aided Purchase of Stake in China Insurer

byline.original: By David Barboza and Mark Scott
